scenes.narration: Here's the breakdown of the lecture script into scenes for video production:  **Scene 1: Introduction to Calculus**

scenes.title: Visual description: Animated text "Calculus" appears on screen, with a subtle background animation of changing patterns or shapes to represent change.
Visual description: Simple animations illustrating the concepts of differentiation (e.g., a ball moving, with velocity vectors) and integration (e.g., a accumulating area under a curve).
Visual description: Text "Differential Calculus" appears on screen, with an animation of a function graph and a tangent line representing the derivative.
Visual description: Animated mathematical notation, with the function 𝑓(𝑥) and its derivative 𝑓′(𝑥) displayed on screen, along with a simple illustration of the limit definition.
Visual description: Graph of the function 𝑦 = 𝑥² appears on screen, with an animation of the tangent line at a point 𝑥, illustrating the slope.
Visual description: Text "Integral Calculus" appears on screen, with an animation of a accumulating area under a curve.

Visual description: Animated mathematical notation, with the integral sign and the function 𝑓(𝑥) displayed on screen, along with a simple illustration of the area under the curve and the limit definition.
scenes.narration: Note: The duration of each scene is an estimate, and the actual duration may vary depending on the pace of the narration and the complexity of the visual descriptions.
